sen.e: He also used "Ishikawa clan" as his surname due to the fact that, since the time of MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, the founder of the Kawachi-genji line, the clan manor had been the Kawachi Ishikawa Manor (which today would be located in the city of Habikino in Osaka Pref.).

sen.j: 治承四年（1180年）冬、以仁王の令旨を受けて全国の源氏勢が蜂起する中、河内源氏のかつて本拠地の河内石川の源氏の存在を危険視した平清盛は、策略を用いて義基ら石川源氏の主力を鳥羽（京都市伏見区）まで誘い出し、一気に包囲して殲滅させた。
sen.e: In the winter of 1180, during the nation-wide revolt of the Minamoto forces in response to the princely command of Prince Mochihito, TAIRA no Kiyomori, who regarded the existence of the Minamoto forces at Kawachi Ishikawa manor, long a stronghold of the Kawachi-genji, as a dangerous threat, put a plan in motion which lured Yoshimoto and the greater part of the Ishikawa-genji strength away to Toba (today's Fushimi-ku Ward in Kyoto), where he quickly had them surrounded and annihilated.

sen.j: この際、老齢の義基も先頭に立って戦ったが、武運つたなく討ち死にした。
